decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match the original facing materials of the existing buildings in type, colour, dimensions and in the case of brickwork, bond, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 3 - The roof of the exsiting ground floor extension shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden, sitting out area or for any other purpose of a similar nature without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The proposed rear roof extension would not have a detrimental impact upon the appearance and character of the existing building and surrounds, nor impinge unreasonably upon the amenities of neighbouring properties. The proposal therefore meets with the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (October 2003) and London Plan policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal:
BE.15: New Buildings and Extensions; Daylight, Sunlight, Privacy, Visual Intrusion and Noise 
BE.16: Urban Design 
BE.22: Design of New Development
BE.23: Alterations and Extensions to Buildings 
BE.24: Roof Extensions and Dormer Windows
description: ERECTION OF A REAR MANSARD ROOF EXTENSION
